meanings.sent1: She redials her friend's number to make sure they got the message.
meanings.sent2: He always redials when the call doesn't go through the first time.
meanings.sent3: The phone redials on its own, playing a prank on its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her determination redials like a persistent echo in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the dial tone redials in her memory, bringing back nostalgia.

meanings.definition: The act of dialing a telephone number again.
meanings.sent1: After several redials, she finally got through to customer service.
meanings.sent2: He kept a record of all the redials he made to reach his doctor.
meanings.sent3: The redials on his phone showed his impatience with technology.
meanings.sent4: The redials on her phone bill reflected her persistent efforts to connect.
meanings.sent5: The pile of redials on his desk indicated a busy day of phone calls.
